### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

After installing PowerShell 7 on Server 2016, when users (both regular users and admins) go to view volume shadow copies of a folder for a specific date by going to Properties > Previous Versions, pressing the ‘Open’ button opens a blank PowerShell 7 window in the location of the shadow copy (\\\server\share\\@timestamp\folder) instead of opening the folder in File Explorer. Opening the folder by double-clicking on the listed folder opens it normally in File Explorer. I’ve run Process Monitor to attempt to narrow down the issue, and I can see Explorer launching the pwsh.exe process, but I wasn’t able to obtain much other useful information.

### Expected behavior

```console
Pressing 'Open' in the Previous Versions list with a folder selected should open the selected folder in File Explorer instead of opening a PowerShell 7 console window.
```


### Actual behavior

```console
Pressing the ‘Open’ button in the Previous Versions list with a folder selected opens a blank PowerShell 7 window in the location of the shadow copy (\\server\share\@timestamp\folder) instead of opening the folder in File Explorer. Opening the folder by double-clicking on the listed folder opens it normally in File Explorer.
```


### Error details

```console
There is no error message, just unexpected behavior.
```


### Environment data

```powershell
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.2.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.2.1
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.14393
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```


### Visuals

Unable to post screenshots, as they contain specific UNC paths and server names.

comments.body: Update to this: I confirmed that uninstalling PowerShell 7 does resolve the issue.
